Title: Pack Up  + Go
Touch points: Hear about Pack Up + Go on imgur | Visit website | Read reviews from other travellers
Notes: I don;t trust the reviews on the company’s website. I’m going to do my own research to validate whether this thing is legit.
Opportunities: Create a hashtag or public forum for anyone to contribute their thoughts, good, bad or otherwise

Touch points: Preview survey before filling it out
Notes: The survey is displayed on the website to preview all the questions before committing to signing up for a trip

Opportunities: The order summary which included my survey responses was hard to read and verify what I had submitted

Touch points: Email: Your trip is around the corner! Look for info soon
Notes: Tell all our friendsabout this crazy cool thing we are trying

Touch points: One week before trip, receive email with weatrher, what to pack, where to go
Notes: Since we were travellingover halloween, they mentioned provdiingsome fun ways to celebrate in costume in our mystery city
Opportunities: Pain point: The airport was a 3 hr drive away and since the flight was leavinfg very early, we got a hotel near the airport.

Touch points: Day before, receive updated weather info | Receive envelope not to be opened until departure
Notes: If you try to peek through the back of the envelope, you can see a page that says ‘No Peeking’. Clever Pack Up + Go

Touch points: Morning of, receive boaridn passes for flight and open our envelope! Denver here we come! | get an email with itineries, hotel info, and activities
Notes: The packet of info is printed on cardstock. They also created a google map with all the recommended restaurants and attractions.
Opportunities: We were hoping to get some of the local faves in terms of restaurants and bars. Could be an opportunity tp highlight previous traveller or local recommendations.

Touch points: Receive our departing boarind passes via email
Notes: Not only did they include tickets to a microbrewery and the art museum, we were given a gift card for Uber to get around town.

Touch points: Follow-up survey and invitation to share photos and testimonials for the website
Notes: We had the same travel cponcierge from start to finish. Thanks Jordan!
